meanings.definition: Not having a separation of electric charge.
meanings.sent1: The nonpolar molecule does not attract or repel other molecules.
meanings.sent2: Water is a polar molecule, while oil is nonpolar.
meanings.sent3: The nonpolar magnets refused to stick together, much to their disappointment.
meanings.sent4: Her nonpolar personality made it hard for others to read her emotions.
meanings.sent5: The nonpolar bond between the atoms was like two friends holding hands, neither positive nor negative.

meanings.sent1: The nonpolar substance had an even distribution of charge.
meanings.sent2: In chemistry, nonpolar compounds share electrons equally.
meanings.sent3: The nonpolar cat refused to choose between the two identical toys.
meanings.sent4: His nonpolar attitude towards the situation surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: The nonpolar nature of the landscape gave it a sense of calm and balance.

meanings.definition: Not having a positive or negative pole.
meanings.sent1: The nonpolar magnet had no distinct ends.
meanings.sent2: A nonpolar molecule has a symmetrical distribution of charge.
meanings.sent3: The nonpolar battery refused to power any device, much to the frustration of the user.
meanings.sent4: Her nonpolar viewpoint allowed her to see both sides of the argument.
meanings.sent5: The nonpolar relationship between the two countries kept the peace for decades.
